stance_1: I eat meat once or twice a day
stance_2: I enjoy the taste of chicken, fish, turkey, seafood
justification: Enjoying the taste of meat is a primary reason for eating meat regularly, as directly stated.

stance_1: I eat meat once or twice a day
stance_2: I have digestive problems from too much meat
justification: Digestive problems from too much meat limit the frequency of meat consumption, supporting moderation.

stance_1: I eat meat once or twice a day
stance_2: I try to have at least one meatless meal daily
justification: The effort to have at least one meatless meal daily directly shapes the frequency of meat-eating.

stance_1: I eat meat once or twice a day
stance_2: I want to get enough protein
justification: Ensuring adequate protein intake is a major motivation for eating meat regularly.

stance_1: I enjoy the taste of chicken, fish, turkey, seafood
stance_2: I want to get enough protein
justification: Both taste and protein needs are cited as main reasons for choosing to eat meat.

stance_1: I have digestive problems from too much meat
stance_2: I try to have at least one meatless meal daily
justification: Digestive issues from excessive meat are the reason for intentionally including meatless meals.
